RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: I'm graduated in Biomedical Engineering from Politecnico di Milano (2005) with a thesis on gait patters of patients with hemiplegia. I got a PhD at Industrial Engineering from Università degli Studi di Cagliari (2010). At present I'm Research Assistant at the Department of Electronics, Information and Bioengineering Department of Politecnico di Milano and I'm working at ?Luigi Divieti? Posture and Movement Analysis Laboratory since 4 years. My research activity is mainly focused on quantitative movement analysis for clinical and rehabilitative applications (in particular in neuro-degenerative pathologies, eating disorders and oncological field). I'm also involved in the activity of motion analysis laboratories and specific projects in national institutes. I'm the official teaching assistant in the course of "Functional Evaluation? of Master?s degree course in Biomedical Engineering at Politecnico di Milano.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: I'm graduated in Biomedical Engineering from Politecnico di Milano (2005) with a thesis on gait patters of patients with hemiplegia. I got a PhD at Industrial Engineering from Università degli Studi di Cagliari (2010). At present I'm Research Assistant at the Department of Electronics, Information and Bioengineering Department of Politecnico di Milano and I'm working at ?Luigi Divieti? Posture and Movement Analysis Laboratory since 4 years. My research activity is mainly focused on quantitative movement analysis for clinical and rehabilitative applications (in particular in neuro-degenerative pathologies, eating disorders and oncological field). I'm also involved in the activity of motion analysis laboratories and specific projects in national institutes. I'm the official teaching assistant in the course of "Functional Evaluation? of Master?s degree course in Biomedical Engineering at Politecnico di Milano.

MESTRADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: The classification of different forms of hemiplegia using gait analysis technique

DOUTORADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: A fluidodynamic and acoustic investigation of infant incubators

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Main Activities: - Evaluation of the biomechanical outcomes based on motion analysis after rehabilitation programs (surgery, pharmacological treatments, physiotherapy) - Protocol development and implementation - Data collection and analysis / quality checks - Writing of congress contributions and scientific papers - Preparation of documents to be submitted to Ethics Committees - Involvement in funded research projects: IRCCS National Cancer Institute of Milan (Breast Cancer and Lymphedema project ? Polisocial Award 2012-2013) - Supervisor of bachelor and master thesis data acquisition and elaboration. - Support to web site management
VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: Main Activities: - Evaluation of the biomechanical outcomes based on motion analysis after rehabilitation programs (surgery, pharmacological treatments, physiotherapy) - Protocol development and implementation - Data collection and analysis / quality checks - Writing of congress contributions and scientific papers - Preparation of documents to be submitted to Ethics Committees - Involvement in funded research projects: IRCCS National Cancer Institute of Milan (Breast Cancer and Lymphedema project ? Polisocial Award 2012-2013) - Supervisor of bachelor and master thesis data acquisition and elaboration. - Support to web site management

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Relevant Projects: Sound propagation in insulating and periodic materials. Application in advanced mechanical field Overview of activities: ? Study and modeling innovative solutions of soundproof materials for buildings and aeronautics applications. Testing of samples for the acoustic characterization (absorbing coefficient in different configurations).
VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: Relevant Projects: Sound propagation in insulating and periodic materials. Application in advanced mechanical field Overview of activities: ? Study and modeling innovative solutions of soundproof materials for buildings and aeronautics applications. Testing of samples for the acoustic characterization (absorbing coefficient in different configurations).

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: - Development and implementation of clinical protocols for functional evaluation in different pathologies ( especially in obese and neurological patients ? Strokes and Parkinson)) - Data collection and analysis (over more than hundreds of subjects) - Development of algorithms for biomechanical parameters - Use, calibration and maintenance of laboratory equipment (Optoelectronic Systems, Force Platform, Baropodometry and EMG) - Evaluation of the biomechanical outcomes after rehabilitation programs (surgery, pharmacological treatments, physiotherapy) - Supporting scientific coordination - Sharing of results and discussion with physician, physiotherapists and other healthcare professionals for the improvement of clinical treatments and outcomes - Writing of congress contributions and scientific papers
VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: - Development and implementation of clinical protocols for functional evaluation in different pathologies ( especially in obese and neurological patients ? Strokes and Parkinson)) - Data collection and analysis (over more than hundreds of subjects) - Development of algorithms for biomechanical parameters - Use, calibration and maintenance of laboratory equipment (Optoelectronic Systems, Force Platform, Baropodometry and EMG) - Evaluation of the biomechanical outcomes after rehabilitation programs (surgery, pharmacological treatments, physiotherapy) - Supporting scientific coordination - Sharing of results and discussion with physician, physiotherapists and other healthcare professionals for the improvement of clinical treatments and outcomes - Writing of congress contributions and scientific papers

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Quantitative assessment of limbs affected by lymphoedema and their recovery after specific rehabilitative treatments
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Grant holder in a research project funded by Fondazione Cariplo titled ?Patologia oncologica e long survivals: Valutazione quantitativa di arti affetti da linfedema e loro recupero a seguito di trattamenti riabilitativi specifici?- Bando ?5x1000 Polisocial Award, Ed. 2012-2013 aimed to the definition, development and implementation of experimental protocols for quantitative analysis of upper and lower limbs with lymphedema. This project is in collaboration with National Institute of Cancer - INT Milano
